description.narrative:
The overall objectives of the SPF are to (i) improve governance and institutional performance in FCV-affected regions to boost resilience to internal and external stresses; and (ii) develop the socio-economic conditions that foster peaceful, stable, and sustainable development.
The SPF seeks to achieve its objectives through the financing of activities across its five priority focus areas mentioned below, while mainstreaming gender and ICT.
a) Prevention, resilience and recovery b) Crisis response c) Forced displacement d) H-D-P initiatives e) Financing solutions

title.narrative: The overall objectives of the SPF are to (i) improve governance and institutional performance in FCV-affected regions to boost resilience to internal and external stresses; and (ii) develop the socio-economic conditions that foster peaceful, stable, and sustainable development. The SPF seeks to achieve its objectives through the financing of activities across its five priority focus areas mentioned below, while mainstreaming gender and ICT. a) Prevention, resilience and recovery b) Crisis response c) Forced displacement d) H-D-P initiatives e) Financing solutions

1. Support implementation or uptake of RRA findings and recommendations
2. Support implementation or uptake of RPBA findings and recommendations
3. Advance or promote inclusive approaches and policies
4. Support institutional reform
5. Support implementation of collective outcomes
6. Catalytic leveraging of other (non-SPF) funding
7. Ratio of funding leveraged
8. SPF-funded projects that are replicated, mainstream, or scale
9. Partners, donors, and other stakeholders recognizing SPF's catalytic support, innovation, and thought leadership
